org.codethechange.culturemesh

Class API

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codethechange.culturemesh.API

  • class API
extends java.lang.Object
    This API serves as the interface between the rest of the app and the CultureMesh servers. When another part of the app needs to request information, it calls API methods to obtain it. Similarly, API methods should be used to store, send, and update information. The API then handles requesting it from the CultureMesh servers.

    • Field Detail

      • SETTINGS_IDENTIFIER

        static final java.lang.String SETTINGS_IDENTIFIER
        Identifier for the app's shared preferences. Example: SharedPreferences settings = getSharedPreferences(API.SETTINGS_IDENTIFIER, MODE_PRIVATE)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTED_NETWORK

        static final java.lang.String SELECTED_NETWORK
        Identifier for the user's currently selected Network. This is used to save the network the user was last viewing so that network can be re-opened when the user navigates back. Example: settings.getLong(API.SELECTED_NETWORK, -1).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTED_USER

        static final java.lang.String SELECTED_USER
        The SharedPreferences key for communicating to ViewProfileActivity which user we are viewing.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CURRENT_USER

        static final java.lang.String CURRENT_USER
        Identifier for the currently-signed-in user's ID. If no user is signed-in, this key should be removed from the preferences Example: settings.getLong(API.CURRENT_USER, -1).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USER_EMAIL

        static final java.lang.String USER_EMAIL
        Identifier for the currently-signed-in user's email. If no user is signed-in, this key should be removed from the preferences Example: settings.getLong(API.USER_EMAIL, -1).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • API_URL_BASE

        static final java.lang.String API_URL_BASE
        Base of the URL all API endpoints use. For example, the /token endpoint has the URL API_URL_BASE + "/token".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_MAX_PAGINATION

        static final java.lang.String NO_MAX_PAGINATION
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HOSTING

        static final java.lang.String HOSTING
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FEED_ITEM_COUNT_SIZE

        static final java.lang.String FEED_ITEM_COUNT_SIZE
        The number of items (e.g. Posts or Events to fetch with each paginated request
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOGIN_TOKEN

        static final java.lang.String LOGIN_TOKEN
        Settings identifier for the currently cached login token for the user. May be missing or expired. Expiration is tracked using TOKEN_REFRESH.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TOKEN_RETRIEVED

        static final java.lang.String TOKEN_RETRIEVED
        Settings identifier for when the current login token was retrieved. Stored as the number of milliseconds since the epoch.
        See Also:
        LOGIN_TOKEN, Constant Field Values

      • TAG

        private static final java.lang.String TAG
        Tag to use for log statements. It is set dynamically so that if the class name is refactored, the logging tag will be too.

      • TOKEN_REFRESH

        static final int TOKEN_REFRESH
        Number of milliseconds to use a login token before refreshing it. Note that this is not how long the token is valid, just how often to refresh it. Refresh time must be shorter than the validity time.
        See Also:
        LOGIN_TOKEN, Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • emptyModel

        private static void emptyModel(RequestQueue queue,
                               java.lang.String url,
                               java.lang.String func,
                               int requestMethod,
                               android.content.SharedPreferences settings,
                               <any> listener)
        Add to the provided queue a request to the server at the provided URL using the provided method
        Parameters:
        queue - Queue to which the asynchronous task will be added
        url - URL of the endpoint to send the request to
        func - Name of the function making the request for logging purposes
        requestMethod - The method (e.g. POST, PUT, GET, etc.) to use in making the request. Use the constants provided in Request.Method
        settings - Reference to the app's SharedPreferences where the user's login tokens are stored
        listener - Listener that will be called with the result of the task once completed

      • expandDatabaseNetwork

        private static void expandDatabaseNetwork(RequestQueue queue,
                                          org.codethechange.culturemesh.models.DatabaseNetwork dn,
                                          <any> listener)
        DatabaseNetworks do not store all the information associated with a Network. Instead, a DatabaseNetwork is like a bundle of pointers to the parts of the Network it represents. This method "expands" a DatabaseNetwork into a Network by resolving those "pointers" and combining the results. The objects referred to by IDs in the DatabaseNetwork are fetched with API calls and re-bundled into a Network. See the documentation for Location for more information on this inheritance hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        queue - Queue to which the asynchronous task will be added
        dn - DatabaseNetwork to expand into a Network
        listener - Listener whose com.android.volley.Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) is called with the NetworkResponse created by the query.

      • locationToPlace

        private static void locationToPlace(RequestQueue queue,
                                    org.codethechange.culturemesh.models.Location loc,
                                    <any> listener)
        Locations do not store all the information associated with a Place. Instead, a Location is like a bundle of pointers to the parts of the Place it represents. This method "expands" a Location into a Place by resolving those "pointers" and combining the results. The objects referred to by IDs in the Location are fetched with API calls and re-bundled into a Place. See the documentation for Location for more information on this inheritance hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        queue - Queue to which the asynchronous task will be added
        loc - Location to expand into a Place
        listener - Listener whose com.android.volley.Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) is called with the NetworkResponse created by the query.

      • processNetworkError

        private static int processNetworkError(java.lang.String method,
                                       java.lang.String task,
                                       VolleyError error)
        Process errors that could be returned in the form of a VolleyError the Response.Listener
        Parameters:
        method - The method where the error occurred
        task - Description of the task being attempted. This will be included in log entries.
        error - The error returned
        Returns:
        The resource ID of the error message that should be displayed to the user

      • getCredentials

        static java.lang.String getCredentials()
        Use this method to append our credentials to our server requests. For now, we are using a static API key. In the future, we are going to want to pass session tokens.
        Returns:
        credentials string to be appended to request url as a param.

      • genBasicAuth

        static java.lang.String genBasicAuth(java.lang.String email,
                                     java.lang.String password)
        Generate from a username/email and password the string to put in the header of a request as the value of the Authorization token in order to perform Basic Authentication. For example: headers.put("Authorization", genBasicAuth(email, password)). A login token can be used if it is passed as the email, in which case the password is ignored by the server.
        Parameters:
        email - Email or username of account to login as; can also be a login token
        password - Password to login with
        Returns:
        Value that should be passed in the header as the value of Authorization

      • genBasicAuth

        static java.lang.String genBasicAuth(java.lang.String token)
        Generate from a login token the string to put in the header of a request as the value of the Authorization token in order to perform Basic Authentication. For example: headers.put("Authorization", genBasicAuth(token)).
        Parameters:
        token - Login token to authenticate to server
        Returns:
        Value that should be passed in the header as the value of Authorization

      • getPagination

        private static java.lang.String getPagination(java.lang.String id)
        Fetches query parameter string you need to add in to the request url.
        Parameters:
        id - maximum id of item you want to fetch. Use API.NO_MAX_PAGINATION if you want no limit.
        Returns:
        pagination query param to add to request url.
